snippet: A study in the journal JAMA Psychiatry found that 55 percent of young people who tried to kill themselves had received some mental health treatment beforehand.
abstract: Matt Nock study in journal JAMA Psychiatry finds that 55 percent of suicidal teenagers have received some therapy before they thought about suicide, planned it or tried to kill themselves, contradicting widely held belief that suicide is due in part to lack of access to treatment.
lead_paragraph: A study in the journal JAMA Psychiatry found that 55 percent of young people who tried to kill themselves had received some mental health treatment beforehand.

headline.seo: Gaps Seen in Therapy for Suicidal Teenagers
headline.main: Study Questions Effectiveness of Therapy for Suicidal Teenagers
headline.print_headline: Study Questions Effectiveness of Therapy for Suicidal Teenagers
